contentrichtext.text: {{Multiple issues |COI = April 2011 |refimprove = May 2009 }} '''''Drapers''''', formerly '''''Drapers Record''''', is a weekly business-to-business magazine covering the [[fashion]] [[retail]] sector. It was founded on 6 August 1887 as a magazine for the women's clothing retail trade. Formerly owned by publisher [[Thomson Corporation]], it is now owned by [[EMAP]]. == History == Former editors include Freddie Offley, who joined ''Drapers Record'' in 1930 as a trainee clerk, and went on to become director and managing editor before retiring in 1980. From 2000 to 2006, it was run by editorial director Eric Musgrave. In 2007, it is headed by managing director Malcolm Gough. In 1961, ''Drapers Record'' was bought along with the ''[[Illustrated London News]]'', ''Men's Wear'' and the ''[[Tatler (1901)|Tatler]]'' by the [[Thomson Corporation]] and formed into the new Thomson Publications business. Thomson sold ''Drapers Record'' in 1985, along with the ''Illustrated London News'', ''Family Circle'', ''Living'', and ''Construction News''. From 1988 to 1992, it was known as ''DR The Fashion Business'', but from 1992 it returned to its original name of ''Drapers Record''. In 2002, ''Drapers Record'' merged with sister title, ''Men's Wear'', which had been launched in 1902, to become simply ''Drapers''.<ref>Ruth Addicott, [http://www.pressgazette.co.uk/story.asp?storyCode=21605&sectioncode=1 "Drapers Record relaunch to incorporate Menswear",] ''Press Gazette'', 16 August 2002. Retrieved 7 August 2009.</ref> In November 2006, Emap started making a version of the magazine available digitally every week. The website<ref name="Drapersonline.com">https://www.drapersonline.com</ref> was relaunched in 2009.<ref>Paul McNally, [http://www.pressgazette.co.uk/story.asp?storyCode=21605&sectioncode=1 "Emap completes web overhaul with Broadcast relaunch"], ''Press Gazette'', 28 May 2009. Retrieved 7 August 2009.</ref> == Drapers Fashion Summit == The Drapers Fashion Summit is an event held by Drapers.<ref name="emapconferences.co.uk">https://www.emapconferences.co.uk/fashionsummit/who-we-are</ref> It is targeted at fashion retailers and businesses with an interest in retail and fashion.<ref name="emapconferences.co.uk"/> Past speakers include [[Caprice Bourret]], Carl McPhail, [[Caroline Rush]], Dolly Jones, David Hughes and Courtney Blackman.{{fact|date=May 2013}} === Advisory board === *[[Andy Rubin]], CEO, Pentland Group *Peter Williams, Non-Executive Director, ASOS *Eric Musgrave, Industry Expert and former Director General of the UKFT *Mary Homer, Managing Director, Topshop *Peter Ruis, Buying and Brand Director, John Lewis *Michael Sharp, Deputy CEO, Debenhams *Alan Hawkins, CEO, British Independent Retailers Association *Lauretta Roberts, Creative Director, WGSN Boutique *Mike Shearwood, CEO, Aurora Fashions *Bernd Hake, Managing Director UK, Hugo Boss *Mark Bage, Owner, Sarah Coggles *[[Harold Tillman]], CBE Chairman of the British Fashion Council and CEO, Jaeger ==See also== *[[Draper]] *[[Drapers' Company]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.drapersonline.com Drapers web site] * [http://www.fashionsummit.co.uk/ Drapers Fashion Summit] {{EMAP}} [[Category:British business magazines]] [[Category:EMAP]] [[Category:News magazines]] [[Category:Publications established in 1988]] [[Category:1887 establishments in the United Kingdom]]
